title: What is the electron geometry for PH3? - Quora

response.answer_text: The geometry of PH3 is pyramidal. We know the phosphorus atom is in 15 nth group and so it has outermost 5 electrons out of which 3 is used for three normal two electron bond with three hydrogen atoms and there is one electron pair left which make the structure pyramidal from square planar shape… Similarly the shape of NH3 is also pyramidal.
Assuming you mean the geometry of the [math]sp^3[/math] hybridised structure of [math]PH_3[/math], then that is trigonal pyramidal.  Image courtesy Fosfin - Wikipedija, prosta enciklopedija
